item.title: Absolutes in the Unsea
item.description:
Begin with the knowledge that I am not lying, and the knowledge that I am not telling the truth.

The Unsea is described, charted, navigated differently by everything that touches it. There are patterns, of course, shared terms and methods; the Unsea as a name is, itself, a part of the Unsea. Any lie that has ever been told is in there. Any truth that has been is, as well.

item.title: Three questions, to start.
item.description:
What is the difference, between truth and lie?

Where is the delineation, between real and unreal?

When you tell a story, what are you doing?

item.title: A Gate, of Sorts.
item.description:
so you’ve talked, to that mage you know, and it’s told you the outline of things, spoken of skills and tools and metaphors for horrible things and useful things. and you get it, or at least you mostly do.

and that mage you know, you’ve asked it questions, and it’s told you near-answers and hedged its words, and told you that it can’t tell you everything, and that’s fine, language has a limit, but you do want to learn more. so you ask, of course, because it encourages questions.
